result.execSummary:
All charges against Carlos Lamont Davis in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlos Lamont Davis is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Lamont Davis

Defendant Carlos Lamont Davis in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Carlos Lamont Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Carlos Lamont Davis in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Carlos Lamont Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture and have no further motions prior to trial.  However, defense counsel advises Court of possible resolution status.  Case remains scheduled for Jury Trial on 10/26/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.

Court orders oral no violent contact with LLC's children. Court orders an oral straight no contact order with LLC. Defendant to have no contact with LLC at all at this time.

Defendant Carlos Lamont Davis in court.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 

Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
